title: Opinion | A new leap in opportunities for the exploration and utilization of space
summary: Although the development of the SLS was driven by launch needs for human exploration of the Moon and Mars, it provides a much greater level of capability for the broader spacefaring community.

title: Investing in Space: The space station kingmaker
summary: Several U.S. companies are working to build new orbiting habitats to replace the aging International Space Station. NASA’s role in seeding the fledgling market was a hot topic at the FAA’s space conference last week.

title: Chinese rocket firm Space Pioneer set for first launch
summary: HELSINKI — Commercial launch firm Space Pioneer announced new funding this week and will soon take a shot at becoming China’s first such company to reach orbit with a liquid propellant rocket. Space Pioneer, full name Beijing Tianbing Technology Co., Ltd., announced Feb. 15 that it recently secured “B+ and “Pre-C” strategic funding rounds. The […]

title: Virgin Galactic aircraft returns to flight
summary: The carrier aircraft for Virgin Galactic’s suborbital spaceplane made its first flight in more than a year Feb. 15 as the company moves one step closer to beginning commercial service.

title: Boeing opens SLS EUS production facility
summary: Boeing has opened the production facility where it will build a new upper stage for an upgraded version of the Space Launch System.

title: Europe approves multi-orbit connectivity constellation plan
summary: Europe’s ambitions for a sovereign connectivity constellation are now in the hands of industry, the European Parliament said Feb. 14 after voting to approve the 6 billion euro ($6.4 billion) plan.

title: Pentagon working with Congress on unclassified space strategy
summary: The Defense Department’s space policy office is drafting a congressionally mandated report explaining how the U.S. will defend satellites in orbit.

title: On National Security | A coming of age for commercial satellite imagery
summary: “Someone’s on the move,” Jeffrey Lewis tweeted on Feb. 23, 2022, the day before Russian forces invaded Ukraine. Known on social media as @ArmsControlWonk, Lewis had been tracking Russian movements in the days preceding the invasion, using synthetic aperture radar (SAR) satellite data from a commercial company, Capella Space. In a recent interview with SpaceNews, […]

title: After a decade in development, Japan’s H3 rocket is ready for its debut
summary: "If we cannot attain that, our development program is completely stopped."

title: Maxar moves to close deal with Advent after receiving no competing offers
summary: The $6.4 billion acquisition of Maxar Technologies by the private equity firm Advent International remains on track to close in mid-2023 following completion of a 60-day “go shop” period when other offers could have been considered.
